ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Numbers on Bards
ygData.msgSnippet: My favorite Cleric (my best RL friend) was grouped with me the last few nights.  He was first complaining about being bored.  Twisting Cantata in during combat
ygData.messageBody:
My favorite Cleric (my best RL friend) was grouped with me the last few nights. He was first complaining
about being bored. Twisting Cantata in during combat and singing it in downtime, he wasn't getting to
heal anybody. (Rogues rock). Then he realized that he could nuke. Hehe.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 55 songs, Innoruuk

PS - I love the fix they did to mez. I had a four person group in Seb tonight that handled 7 frogs (five
initial, two adds) with no Enchanter and no Cleric. Mez seems to last a little longer than the normal
song, I can sing a full five during a twist, which lets me control 3-4 things with 1-2 resists. (Lag
depending.)


"Mott, Mike J." wrote:

> Another point about Clerics and Heals...my clerics (it sounds so possesive
> doesnt it?) have learned to wait on healing up the less banged up members of
> the party until they have medded to full mana. The health regen is quite
> impressive when I am singing the lvl 55 cantana with the 7 string lute in
> hand during downtime, especially if another group regen spell is active on
> the party. Why should a cleric burn mana on a party member that will regen
> up over the same time it takes the cleric to regain his mana to a "Ready"
> level?
>
> This is just another way of reducing downtime that we have discovered, but
> one which less experienced clerics and groups do not recognize.
>
> Lago
>
